page.title: 02A Short History of Felton.
page.content: Felton lies on the main route from Newcastle to Edinburgh on the River Coquet.Many years ago there was a ford across the river. The old bridge was built in the 15th Century but was widened twice to cope with the traffic.In the early 1940's a wide bridge was built.At that time there were about 10 shops,a bank and a reading room.There have been at least 8 pubs in Felton at different times,some for the travellers going N.,S.or E.to Acklington station.There were also 2 schools.Many of the houses on the main street were once shops,you can see the signs on the old stone if you look carefully. The present Post Office used to be a pub called the"Widdrington Arms".Another local landowning family was Riddell they built a private R.C.chapel at Felton Park.
